poem:
"Of Power and Complaints"

In the gears of commerce, Hester cries,
A cog rich with Tory gold, echoing under sterile skies.
NHS contract bid, an arena of dismay,
Invisible hands guide the capitalist play.
His missive bleeds into the bureaucratic maze,
In the muted murmurs of the health secretary's gaze.
The echoes of power, where money inscribes,
In man's quiet struggle, a tech titan describes.
